Issues.Title: Fixes #13901. Properly displays PropertyGrid` color and cursor dropdowns when using Dark Mode
Issues.Body: Fixes #13901 ## Root Cause `ColorEditor.ColorUI` and `CursorEditor.CursorUI` use owner-draw ListBoxes with custom `OnDrawItem` handlers that use `DrawItemEventArgs.ForeColor` for text rendering. In Dark Mode, this property returns dark text color for selected items, creating poor contrast against the bright blue selection background. ## Proposed changes - Modified `ColorEditor.ColorUI.OnListDrawItem()` to use `SystemColors.ControlText` for selected item text in Dark Mode - Modified `CursorEditor.CursorUI.OnDrawItem()` to use `SystemColors.ControlText` for selected item text in Dark Mode ## Customer Impact Users can now properly read selected items in `PropertyGrid` color and cursor dropdowns when using Dark Mode. ## Regression? No ## Risk Minimal ## Screenshots ### Before ### After ## Test methodology Manual testing ## Test environment(s) - 10.0.100-rc.1.25420.111 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/13950)

Issues.Title: Handle unterminated string data in DataObject
Issues.Body:
Manually look for the terminator and return empty string if there is no terminator. Throw for bad HGLOBALs.

Needed to add some more code for testing nested private generic classes.

Fixes #13929

Issues.Title: Application size
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

Version 8, 9, 10.

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No

### Issue description

Hello
I realize that this is a debated problem, and i have found some issues on the topic, but no clear answer.

In .Net Framwork we could create winforms tools sub 10Mb, Now, we can not build small single file portable tools unless we set it to be self-contained, that ballons the size to 100MB.

If we want to avoid this size, we need to remove slf-contained. 
However this brings another problem, if these tools are for use on Windows Servers, as many of mine are, even if the server has the correct hosting runtime the app still need to install the desktop runtime.
I don't want to install desktop runtime on every server where i need to run the tools, so it seems that there are no solution.

My question is:
Is there any way/plan to make it easyer to make smaller slef-contained apps?
PublishAot as you know is not suitable for most apps and installing desktop runtime on servers feels strange.

I'm i missing something or is this just as it seems, a unsolvable problem?

I realize that you may not be a interesting point, but since neither UI model (Winforms, MAUI, WinUI) can produce portalble small apps we are kind a stuk.

At this point, given the size of the produced portable app sizes, its seems that its better just to use Electron. 
The size is the same and at least we get a decent cross platform app.


Thnak you

### Steps to reproduce

Just a simple winforms app, self-contained or a platform dependent on a server without the desktop runtime.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Application size" (#13945)

Issues.Title: Restoring the old LocProject.json file to fix OneLocBuild task failure
Issues.Body:
**Issue:** Since we made changes to LocProject.json file for WixV5 localization, the OneBuildLoc task started failing due to LocProject.json mismatch between the existing file in the repo and the generated one. The difference was in line endings.

**Fix:** Restoring an old version of the file which fixes the issue. Here is a successful CI build with the changes: https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/internal/_build/results?buildId=2810369&view=results

Issues.Title: Accessibility regression: GetChildCount() not called for Panel
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0.20 and 9.0.9

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, working in .NET 6

### Issue description

After migrating our app from 4.8 to 8.0 some automated UI tests stopped working.
It turns out accessibility for a Panel (used as a status bar) is no longer working because ControlAccessibleObject.GetChildCount() and GetChild(int index) are never called.

Checked for breaking changes in .NET 7 and 8 and couldn't find anything related to this.

### Steps to reproduce

[WinFormsApp1.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22721002/WinFormsApp1.zip)

1. Open the attached project
2. Run the project for the different framworks. Set a breakpoint in GetChildCount() and observe the object hierarchy in Inspect.exe.  
  - .Net 4.8 and 6.0 -> GetChildCount() is called and the panel has 42 children in Inspect.
  - .Net 8.0 [edit: and 9.0] -> GetChildCount() is not called and the panel has no children in Inspect.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Accessibility regression: GetChildCount() not called for Panel" (#13936)

Issues.Title: Does WinForms react to Dark Mode settings changes in SettingsApp of Windows (WM_SETTINGCHANGE message (lParam pointing to string "ImmersiveColorSet"))?
Issues.Body:
> Does WinForms now react to Dark Mode settings changes in SettingsApp of Windows (WM_SETTINGCHANGE message (lParam pointing to string "ImmersiveColorSet")) and redraws all control to new applied Theme? 

Because the other issue is now locked I create a new issue about it. People use software like [Windows-Auto-Night-Mode](https://github.com/AutoDarkMode/Windows-Auto-Night-Mode) to change the theme depending of time of the day and I want to know if WinForms detect this changed theme in .NET10 or not.

 _Originally posted by @MagicAndre1981 in [#13805](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/13805#issuecomment-3225136472)_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Does WinForms react to Dark Mode settings changes in SettingsApp of Windows (WM_SETTINGCHANGE message (lParam pointing to string "ImmersiveColorSet"))?" (#13935)

Issues.Title: Updating LocProject.json as per the generated file by OneLocBuild
Issues.Body:
**Issue**: As part of CI build, OneLocBuild task generates LocProject.json and compares it with the contents of this file which is checked in to the repo. If there is a mismatch, the task fails.

As part of [WixV5 localization changes](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/13923), we updated LocProject.json with .wxl file entry, but it caused a mismatch as the the task expects file entry to be added in an existing node rather than a new node.

**Fix**: Added the .wxl file entry in the expected place

Issues.Title: Localization for WindowsDesktop WixV5 bundle
Issues.Body:
Adding bundle.wxl files for WixV5 installer from WindowsDesktop repo to this repo for localization.
Since WindowsDesktop repo is not onboarded to OneLocBuild, we are piggybacking on winforms repo for localization.

The localized files will be copied back to WindowsDesktop repo.

**Note**: I will create a document in WindowsDesktop repo about this localization process.
